Events.text: Second Punic War: Battle of the Trebia – Hannibal's Carthaginian forces defeat those of the Roman Republic.
Events.html: Second Punic War: Battle of the Trebia – Hannibal's Carthaginian forces defeat those of the Roman Republic.

Events.text: Kublai Khan renames his empire "Yuan" (元 yuán), officially marking the start of the Yuan dynasty of Mongolia and China.
Events.html: Kublai Khan renames his empire "Yuan" (元 yuán), officially marking the start of the Yuan dynasty of Mongolia and China.

Events.text: Portuguese forces score a military victory over the Kingdom of Kongo at the Battle of Mbumbi in present-day Angola.
Events.html: Portuguese forces score a military victory over the Kingdom of Kongo at the Battle of Mbumbi in present-day Angola.

Events.text: The Whitehall Conference ends with the determination that there was no law preventing Jews from re-entering England after the Edict of Expulsion of 1290.
Events.html: The Whitehall Conference ends with the determination that there was no law preventing Jews from re-entering England after the Edict of Expulsion of 1290.

Events.text: The inhabitants of Derry shut the city gates against the Irish Army of James II.
Events.html: The inhabitants of Derry shut the city gates against the Irish Army of James II.

Events.text: The United States celebrates its first Thanksgiving, marking the recent victory by the Americans over British General John Burgoyne in the Battle of Saratoga in October.
Events.html: The United States celebrates its first Thanksgiving, marking the recent victory by the Americans over British General John Burgoyne in the Battle of Saratoga in October.

Events.text: New Jersey becomes the third state to ratify the U.S. Constitution.
Events.html: New Jersey becomes the third state to ratify the U.S. Constitution.

Events.text: Surrender of the frigate La Lutine by French Royalists to Lord Samuel Hood; renamed HMS Lutine, she later becomes a famous treasure wreck.
Events.html: Surrender of the frigate La Lutine by French Royalists to Lord Samuel Hood; renamed HMS Lutine, she later becomes a famous treasure wreck.

Events.text: The national anthem of the Russian Empire, "God Save the Tsar!", is first performed.
Events.html: The national anthem of the Russian Empire, "God Save the Tsar!", is first performed.

Events.text: US Secretary of State William Seward proclaims the adoption of the Thirteenth Amendment, prohibiting slavery throughout the USA.
Events.html: US Secretary of State William Seward proclaims the adoption of the Thirteenth Amendment, prohibiting slavery throughout the USA.

links.title: Thirteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution

Events.text: The Al-Thani family become the rulers of the state of Qatar.
Events.html: The Al-Thani family become the rulers of the state of Qatar.

Events.text: Richard Wetherill and his brother in-law discover the ancient Indian ruins of Cliff Palace in Mesa Verde.
Events.html: Richard Wetherill and his brother in-law discover the ancient Indian ruins of Cliff Palace in Mesa Verde.

Events.text: Premiere performance of The Nutcracker by Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky in Saint Petersburg, Russia.
Events.html: Premiere performance of The Nutcracker by Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky in Saint Petersburg, Russia.

Events.text: Gaston de Chasseloup-Laubat sets the first officially recognized land speed record of 39.245 mph (63.159 km/h) in a Jeantaud electric car.
Events.html: Gaston de Chasseloup-Laubat sets the first officially recognized land speed record of 39.245 mph (63.159 km/h) in a Jeantaud electric car.

Events.text: The Upper Ferntree Gully to Gembrook, Victoria Narrow-gauge (2 ft 6 in or 762 mm) Railway (now the Puffing Billy Railway) in Victoria, Australia is opened for traffic.
Events.html: The Upper Ferntree Gully to Gembrook, Victoria Narrow-gauge (2 ft 6 in or 762 mm) Railway (now the Puffing Billy Railway) in Victoria, Australia is opened for traffic.

Events.text: World War I: The Battle of Verdun ends when German forces under Chief of staff Erich von Falkenhayn are defeated by the French, and suffer 337,000 casualties.
Events.html: World War I: The Battle of Verdun ends when German forces under Chief of staff Erich von Falkenhayn are defeated by the French, and suffer 337,000 casualties.

Events.text: The resolution containing the language of the Eighteenth Amendment to enact Prohibition is passed by the United States Congress.
Events.html: The resolution containing the language of the Eighteenth Amendment to enact Prohibition is passed by the United States Congress.

links.title: Eighteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution

Events.text: The Chicago Bears defeat the Portsmouth Spartans in the first NFL Championship Game.
Events.html: The Chicago Bears defeat the Portsmouth Spartans in the first NFL Championship Game.

Events.text: The Lanka Sama Samaja Party is founded in Ceylon.
Events.html: The Lanka Sama Samaja Party is founded in Ceylon.

Events.text: World War II: The Battle of the Heligoland Bight, the first major air battle of the war, takes place.
Events.html: World War II: The Battle of the Heligoland Bight, the first major air battle of the war, takes place.

Events.text: World War II: Seventy-seven B-29 Superfortress and 200 other aircraft of U.S. Fourteenth Air Force bomb Hankow, China, a Japanese supply base.
Events.html: World War II: Seventy-seven B-29 Superfortress and 200 other aircraft of U.S. Fourteenth Air Force bomb Hankow, China, a Japanese supply base.

Events.text: Project SCORE, the world's first communications satellite, is launched.
Events.html: Project SCORE, the world's first communications satellite, is launched.

Events.text: Saturn's moon Epimetheus is discovered by astronomer Richard Walker.
Events.html: Saturn's moon Epimetheus is discovered by astronomer Richard Walker.

Events.text: Vietnam War: President Richard Nixon announces that the United States will engage North Vietnam in Operation Linebacker II, a series of Christmas bombings, after peace talks collapsed with North Vietnam on the 13th.
Events.html: Vietnam War: President Richard Nixon announces that the United States will engage North Vietnam in Operation Linebacker II, a series of Christmas bombings, after peace talks collapsed with North Vietnam on the 13th.

Events.text: Soviet Soyuz Programme: Soyuz 13, crewed by cosmonauts Valentin Lebedev and Pyotr Klimuk, is launched from Baikonur in the Soviet Union.
Events.html: Soviet Soyuz Programme: Soyuz 13, crewed by cosmonauts Valentin Lebedev and Pyotr Klimuk, is launched from Baikonur in the Soviet Union.

Events.text: The Islamic Development Bank is founded.
Events.html: 1973 – The Islamic Development Bank is founded.

Events.text: First flight of the Russian heavy strategic bomber Tu-160, the world's largest combat aircraft, largest supersonic aircraft and largest variable-sweep wing aircraft built.
Events.html: First flight of the Russian heavy strategic bomber Tu-160, the world's largest combat aircraft, largest supersonic aircraft and largest variable-sweep wing aircraft built.

Events.text: Larry Wall releases the first version of the Perl programming language.
Events.html: Larry Wall releases the first version of the Perl programming language.

Events.text: NASA launches into orbit the Terra platform carrying five Earth Observation instruments, including ASTER, CERES, MISR, MODIS and MOPITT.
Events.html: NASA launches into orbit the Terra platform carrying five Earth Observation instruments, including ASTER, CERES, MISR, MODIS and MOPITT.

links.title: Advanced Spaceborne Thermal Emission and Reflection Radiometer
Clouds and the Earth's Radiant Energy System

Events.text: California gubernatorial recall: Then Governor of California Gray Davis announces that the state would face a record budget deficit of $35 billion, roughly double the figure reported during his reelection campaign one month earlier.
Events.html: California gubernatorial recall: Then Governor of California Gray Davis announces that the state would face a record budget deficit of $35 billion, roughly double the figure reported during his reelection campaign one month earlier.

Events.text: The Chadian Civil War begins when rebel groups, allegedly backed by neighbouring Sudan, launch an attack in Adré.
Events.html: The Chadian Civil War begins when rebel groups, allegedly backed by neighbouring Sudan, launch an attack in Adré.

Events.text: The first of a series of floods strikes Malaysia. The death toll of all flooding is at least 118, with over 400,000 people displaced.
Events.html: The first of a series of floods strikes Malaysia. The death toll of all flooding is at least 118, with over 400,000 people displaced.

Events.text: United Arab Emirates holds its first-ever elections.
Events.html: 2006 – United Arab Emirates holds its first-ever elections.

Events.text: Kellingley Colliery, the last deep coal mine in Great Britain, closes.
Events.html: 2015 – Kellingley Colliery, the last deep coal mine in Great Britain, closes.
